text.p: Shares in Russian national telecoms group Rostelekom have further potential to rise and are rated a buy, Robert Fleming Securities Ltd said on Wednesday.
"Rostelekom is a prime play on the success of the Russian economic recovery," it said in a research note by analyst Diana Zehetner.
"Although political risk is expected to remain an issue for some time to come, the Russian telecoms sector strikes us as relatively unaffected by political turmoil," it said.
"Rostelekom's transparency and investor-friendly attitude stand out in the Russian context."
Share prices were far from discounting the company's prospects despite a strong performance before and after the presidential election, it said.
Shares had the potential to reach $3.50, it said.
Rostelekom was $2.74 on the Russian Trading System at 1345 GMT, up from $2.69 on Tuesday.
Sales are likely to grow a real 11 percent a year until 2000, as economic recovery boosts domestic and international traffic and more phones are sold.
Traffic gains will be more important than tariff increases for sales growth as the market becomes more competitive.
But profit growth will be held back by depreciation charges, with pretax profit rising six percent on average a year to 2000.
